column4: can anyone recommend a video card w/ open source drivers thats of comparable performance to a 7600gs, at least for beryl and minimum games like GW via wine?
such a beast does not exist
intel and early ati cards have open source drivers, the performance is a bit crap though
the nouveau project is making open source nvidia drivers, but there is still a long way to go
I have i915 as well, it's not too bad, and it will get faster eventually, there is still lots of work being done in non-mainline branches, like native modesetting and that new texture thing
thx for the help :)
I think feisty will have the i915tex driver, which improves performance
awesoem :)
but for my desktop, theres neither a reason or a card to move to from my 7600gs? thats too bad :( i thought matrox was O/S friendly, though that was many years ago
I don't think matrox has made a card in years
its been a while :)
intel is the most friendly modern graphics manfacturer
well my desktop has no onboard video. do they make a pci x video card that'll handle beryl and the occasional game through wine?
pci-x or pci express?
PCI-X
your machine doesn't have agp?
I don't think anyone makes pci-x graphics cards :S
pci x only .. its a brand new mobo
do you mean pci express?
apparently so... in the manuel its referred to as pci-x .. whats the diff? :)
pci-x is a faster pci slot that is found usually only on server systems, pci-express is something different and is on all modern desktop systems
pci express supersedes pci and pci-x

intel don't make dedicated graphics cards yet, however there are many rumours that they'll go into the market with one of their latest graphics chipsets, which are supposed to be significantly faster than the i915 stuff
well most definitly pci express then.. :) works like a charm w/ my nvidia 7600gs, i'd just like to support  a company that provides a card w/ OS drivers
